THURS., AUG. 9. 10 ALL SEATS 10c, 25c W e’e r A ll S et F o r T he Big C O U N T Y Friday - Saturday Sunday - Monday FRED NOTH SAYS: “The fair board lias worked hard to tfive the people of Monroe C ounty a well balanced County Fair. “ We will have the best exhibits we have had in years and the p ro g ram is a hum dinger! Wo have a different program for each session of the fair — Seven different program s. 44We have, kept the price of admission down to 25 cents for adults and 1> cents for children so that people can afford to s« all of the program s. The name admission charge will prevail all through the fair. The business men are giving the farm ers exceptional co-operation this year, ,A nd more than 100 of them are donating their time w orking on thee grounds during the fair. We sure do appreciate this eo-operation.” A. E. WEINER SAYS: am mort than satisfied with the splendid exhibits w e have for the Monroe County Fair. The barns and |km is will b e fillet! to capacity with livestock and poultry. The main building will be crowded with individual crop and garden, Homemaker, and domestic art exhibits. “The III clubs will 1‘ at the fair 100 i with some very fine exhibits. ” 1 his is the first year a Junior Fair has been held here in connection with the regular fair and the F uture Farm ers and 111 members are putting it over with a bang.” COUNTY AGENT BEGLEY SAYS: “ I have never seen a finer spirit of co-operation than has 1 shown in organizing the 1939 Monroe County Fair. “Jt has been a pleasure >rk with the various com m ittees anil 1 am lot forw ard to a very successful fair, both from the standpoint of exhibits and entertainm ent. “Special effort has been put forth to interest the young people of the county, anti 1 think this is going to do m uch to make for successful future fairs.” JOE CHRISTMAN SAYS: “ I think the horse pulling contest Saturday afternoon is going to be a world-beater. A num ber of farm ers have entered their teams and 1 know there are some more that are going to slip in at the last minute. Tliere has been m ore interest in the horse pulling contest than 1 have ever seen before/ 4 JOE HONISH SAYS: ‘T understand they are bringing in a num ber of horses for me to break on Saturday afternoon. Tve never fpuntl a hors yet that I couldn't break and if there are any there Saturday afternoon that 1 cannot break I’ll eat them .” CURLEY VERNON SAYS: Tbe Cnited American Shows w ill In on the Midway with a big array of new rkies. shows and concessions fur your entertainm ent.
